events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.summary: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: On a trip to Denmark, a reporter sees lawmakers take on the role of diplomats
events.summary: NPR congressional correspondent Barbara Sprunt watched U.S. lawmakers attempt a diplomatic rescue mission in Denmark amid the Greenland crisis.

events.title: After backsliding, democracy often comes back weaker and more fragile
events.summary: Losing democracy once can make it harder to restore it, even after a democratic government returns to power. University of Birmingham professor Nic Cheeseman analyzed three decades of data.

events.title: Israeli strikes kill 23 Palestinians as Gaza ceasefire inches forward
events.summary: Hospitals in Gaza said Israeli strikes killed at least 23 Palestinians Saturday, one of the highest tolls since the October ceasefire aimed at stopping the fighting.

events.title: With decades-long restrictions lifted, a Pakistani brewery has started exporting beer
events.summary: Drinking is illegal for Pakistan's Muslim majority, but Murree Brewery's beer has long been available to non-Muslims and foreigners there. Now it's being exported to the U.K., Japan and Portugal. Is the U.S. next?

events.title: Venezuela announces amnesty bill that could lead to release of political prisoners
events.summary: Venezuela's acting President Delcy Rodríguez on Friday announced an amnesty bill that could lead to the release of hundreds of prisoners detained for political reasons.

events.title: Unmentioned but present, Trump is a common denominator in Asia-Europe ties
events.summary: Trump was not the only factor behind the agreements, but his shaking up of the global order is worrying friends and foes and driving them closer.

events.title: Voices from Iran: women defy fear in the face of brutal crackdown
events.summary: Amid Iran's deadly crackdown, three women share their stories of resistance, fear and an unyielding hope for freedom.

events.title: Kari Lake promotes Trump on Voice of America. Does that break the law?
events.summary: Critics say U.S. Agency for Global Media's Kari Lake risks making Voice of America sound like a propaganda outlet in her remarks on the air praising President Trump.

events.title: Trump's military interventions concern China despite there being no direct risk
events.summary: China is troubled by President Trump's military interventions and threats of regime change around the world, even if they don't necessarily pose a direct threat to China.

events.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and players banned after African Cup final chaos
events.summary: Africa's soccer body issued fines worth more than $1 million and banned Senegal's coach and Senegalese and Morocco players Wednesday following a shambolic African Cup soccer final this month.

events.title: Liam Ramos: Judge orders release of 5-year-old ICE detainee
events.summary: The boy and his father had been detained by US immigration agents during a Minneapolis raid earlier this month. An image of the boy during the raid sparked outrage and brought a defense from US Vice President JD Vance.

events.title: Germany news: Defense minister says US needs Europe
events.summary: Pistorius has stressed that the US needs Europe just as much as Europe needs the US. Meanwhile, recent research figures show that about one in two Germans will develop cancer in their lifetime. DW has more.

events.title: Belarus: Snow and cold used to torture political prisoners
events.summary: Former political prisoners tell DW that winter in Belarus prisons is brutal during cold, snowy winters like this one — because snow and freezing temperatures are used by guards to torment them.

events.title: Israeli strikes kill more than 30 Palestinians in Gaza
events.summary: A wave of strikes hit different locations across Gaza, including apartments and tents, a day before the Rafah border is set to reopen.

events.title: An undying trend: How vampires like those in 'Sinners' hold a mirror to society
events.summary: As the horror movie "Sinners" stands poised to sweep the Oscars, we take a look at how and why the vampire genre has long captivated audiences — from folklore to film. Is this trend truly immortal?

events.title: Goma under rebel control: Life in the shadow of violence
events.summary: One year after M23 rebels captured Goma, residents of the city in the Democratic Republic of Congo are looking for ways to cope with the trauma.

events.title: Italy church restoration probed after Meloni angel lookalike
events.summary: Many have noted a striking resemblance between the face of an angel in a restored church in Rome and that of Italy's prime minister. "No, decidedly I do not resemble an angel," Giorgia Meloni has said.

events.title: Denmark: Thousands take part in veteran anti-Trump protest
events.summary: The silent march to the US embassy in Copenhagen came after Donald Trump belittled NATO's role in the Afghanistan war. Tensions remain high between the two NATO allies amid Trump's push to acquire Greenland.

events.title: Iran: 1 killed after explosion hit Bandar Abbas Port
events.summary: The blast in the Iranian city of Bandar Abbas comes amid heightened US-Iran tensions. State media has attributed the incident to a gas leak.

events.title: US eyes Red Sea as state envoy visits Africa
events.summary: Washington has said a visit by Deputy Secretary of State Christopher Landau to Africa aims to strengthen bilateral ties, but the timing raises questions about the US's interests in the Red Sea corridor.

events.title: Massive outage knocks out power across Ukraine, Moldova
events.summary: Disruptions to Ukraine's power grid have led to outages there and in neighboring Moldova. Kyiv's metro and water supply have both been affected.

events.title: Germany's AfD bonds with Austrian far-right extremists
events.summary: Officials from the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party have been openly rubbing shoulders with Austrian right-wing extremist Martin Sellner. This, despite reservations over his Identitarian Movement.

events.title: Pakistan: Dozens killed in 'coordinated' Balochistan attacks
events.summary: Officials have said at least 15 security personnel and 92 militants were killed in southwestern Balochistan province. Pakistan has been battling a separatist insurgency in the region for decades.

events.title: DRC: Many killed in coltan mine disaster in east — rebels
events.summary: At least 200 were killed when mines collapsed at a coltan mining site in eastern Congo this week, rebel authorities say. The Rubaya mines, where the disaster occurred, supply a key metal for smartphones and computers.

events.title: 'No end in sight' as Myanmar marks 5-year anniversary of 2021 coup
events.summary: After half a decade of bloody fighting, a resurgent military faces a determined but splintered armed resistance.

events.title: US government enters partial shutdown
events.summary: Funding for around three-quarters of federal operations has been affected after Congress failed to approve a 2026 budget. But the disruption is expected to be of short duration.

events.title: Minneapolis: Thousands rally against Trump immigration blitz
events.summary: Rallies against the Trump administration's hardline immigration tactics were also reported in other cities, such as Los Angeles. It comes as the US Justice Department opened a probe into the killing of Alex Pretti.

events.title: Venezuela: Interim president proposes amnesty bill
events.summary: Venezuelan acting President Delcy Rodriguez announced a general amnesty bill that could see the release of hundreds of political prisoners, including opposition leaders, journalists and human rights activists.

events.title: US Justice Department releases more Epstein files
events.summary: The US Department of Justice has said it released 3 million more pages of documents from the Epstein files. Some Democratic politicians have questioned whether all the files have been made public as legally required.

events.title: Canadian actress Catherine O'Hara dies at 71
events.summary: Catherine O'Hara was famous for starring roles in the series "Schitt's Creek" and the "Home Alone" movies. She got her start with the Second City Toronto comedy troupe in the 1970s before her career in Hollywood.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Kremlin says Trump asked Putin not to hit Kyiv until Feb. 1
events.summary: The Kremlin announced that US President Donald Trump had asked Vladimir Putin to halt strikes on Kyiv until February 1. However, Ukraine reported that Russia launched one missile and over 100 drones overnight. Follow DW.

events.title: Germany news: Hamburg police investigating subway deaths
events.summary: Police in the city of Hamburg are probing a suspected homicide after two people were hit by an underground train. Meanwhile, a survey has found that many Germans who work part-time do so voluntarily. DW has more.

events.title: EU asylum policy: What changes for refugees in Germany?
events.summary: The German government is about to implement the EU's Common European Asylum System (CEAS) to limit irregular migration and speed up asylum procedures.

events.title: Czechia's feud between president and government intensifies
events.summary: Relations between Czech President Petr Pavel and Foreign Minister Petr Macinka have almost completely broken down. With Prime Minister Andrej Babis backing Macinka, the rift between president and government is growing.

events.title: The hidden money behind deep-sea mining
events.summary: A DW investigation traces the hidden financial web behind deep-sea mining — an industry scientists say remains poorly understood, yet capable of causing irreversible harm to oceans worldwide.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Fun events, but what about the bill?
events.summary: Preparations for the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan and Cortina have been far from perfect. Should the Olympics hosting model be changed?

events.title: Cyprus to Greenland: Could UK military bases guide US moves?
events.summary: Following recent reports that President Trump may be interested in establishing US military bases in Greenland along the lines of British Sovereign Base Areas in Cyprus, DW looks at the history and status of these bases.

events.title: Ukraine at war: Battered by Russia and winter but unbending
events.summary: Russian attacks, biting cold, and heat and power outages are grinding Ukrainians down. But polls show a society sticking together under fire and one unwilling to compromise with Russia.

events.title: Can the EU take on Musk over AI 'undressing' feature?
events.summary: The EU is probing Elon Musk's Grok AI after its deepfake feature generated millions of sexualized images of women and children. Brussels is putting its toughest tech laws to one of their biggest test yet.

events.title: Ukraine: Trump says Putin agreed not to hit Kyiv for 1 week
events.summary: President Donald Trump has said Russia's Vladimir Putin "agreed" not to strike the capital for a week with a harsh cold snap forecast. Russia routinely targets Ukraine's electricity supply. Follow DW.

events.title: Trial against German Carnival satirist Tilly underway in Russia
events.summary: Jacques Tilly's Carnival floats mocking Vladimir Putin have landed him before a Moscow court. As the trial drags on, the Dusseldorf-based satirist has denounced the charges as an assault on freedom of expression.

events.title: Silver: Why the price of 'poor man's gold' has hit a record
events.summary: The price of silver has just reached an all-time high of more than $120 per ounce. Although gold has eclipsed the white metal as a store of value, DW explores why silver is regaining global relevance.

events.title: Germany's Bundeswehr goes on military spending spree
events.summary: Germany is spending more on weapons and military equipment than ever before. For the first time, this also includes combat drones.

events.title: Anti-woke Germans in Russia used as propaganda for Putin
events.summary: Media in Moscow are selling a narrative of mass Western migration to Russia, especially from Germany. Numbers contradict the Kremlin's claims.

events.title: Trump tariffs, dollar's dip a double-hit to eurozone exports
events.summary: The euro has reached its highest level against the US dollar since 2021. That has consequences for eurozone companies and consumers, but few think that the European Central Bank should intervene yet.

events.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and banned after AFCON final chaos
events.summary: Africa's governing football body has issued more than $1 million in fines after the chaotic scenes at the end of the AFCON final. In addition, a number of players and Senegal's coach face bans.

events.title: Why fans are obsessed with 'Bridgerton'
events.summary: Opulent romance, a diverse cast and plotlines that meld fairytales with a modern zeitgeist: "Bridgerton" has redefined the period-piece genre.

events.title: Heating with air conditioning saves on cost and cuts CO2
events.summary: From Japan to China and the US to Scandinavia, heating with air conditioning has long been standard practice. But now warming homes with AC is catching on in other parts of the world.

events.title: UK's Keir Starmer visits China as Beijing courts US allies
events.summary: Keir Starmer is in China for the first trip by a British prime minister since 2018. He is the latest in a string of European leaders to visit recently, with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz soon to follow.

events.title: Tesla profit slumps amid lower EV sales, AI spending surge
events.summary: With increased competition and heavy attention on the antics of the company's CEO, Tesla's core electric vehicle business has faltered in the past year.

events.title: German development policy: Partners in the Global South
events.summary: The Federal Minister for Economic Cooperation and Development is focusing on solidarity and partnership in turbulent geopolitical times. Alabali Radovan's trip to Sierra Leone in West Africa illustrates what this means.

events.title: Budapest mayor charged over Pride parade
events.summary: Prosecutors in Hungary are moving against Budapest’s mayor, Gergely Karacsony, after last year's Pride went ahead despite a police ban. The case is being handled without a court hearing and as elections approach.

events.title: Sicily landslide forces evacuation of 1,500
events.summary: A landslide in southern Sicily has homes balanced at the edge of a cliff following days of rain. Officials have said some people won't be able to return to living in their homes.

events.title: Hungary: Cabinet member uses vulgar slur to insult Roma
events.summary: Transportation Minister Janos Lazar says Hungary doesn't need foreign workers and crudely joked that Roma should clean dirty toilets in their stead. Will his comments cost Viktor Orban's party in upcoming elections?

events.title: Arctic scientists 'feel pretty uncomfortable' on Greenland
events.summary: Science in the Arctic — and Greenland — is on the frontline of pressing challenges facing humanity, like climate change and genetics. Some researchers worry international collaboration is at risk.

events.title: CDU, Merz target 'lifestyle part-time' work in Germany
events.summary: A proposal from the economic wing of Germany’s CDU to place tighter restrictions on part-time contracts has come under heavy scrutiny. Chancellor Merz has repeatedly criticized the German work ethic in the past year.

events.title: Amazon cuts more corporate jobs in post-pandemic downsize
events.summary: Amazon told employees that it was cutting 16,000 corporate jobs, completing a downsizing move that began last year. The online retail giant had recruited during a COVID pandemic spike in demand.

events.title: Environmental crises add to Iran's mounting troubles
events.summary: Widespread discontent in Iran has sent millions of protesters into the streets. Poor environmental planning embodies one of the government's most existential vulnerabilities.

events.title: How Germany's skilled worker gap exposes migration hurdles
events.summary: Germany is facing a massive shortage of skilled workers, from nurses to IT specialists. The country needs hundreds of thousands of professionals, but bureaucracy and political hurdles are slowing recruitment abroad.

events.title: What 'banana republic' means — and why its history matters
events.summary: From plantations to political rhetoric, the term's evolution shows how a violent past can fade into metaphor, sometimes obscuring its true history.

events.title: Rwanda takes UK to court over contentious migrant deal
events.summary: Rwanda accuses the UK of "intransigence" and says London owes it millions of pounds.

events.title: Zelenskyy condemns 'terrorism' after Russia hits train in Ukraine
events.summary: A drone struck a train carriage carrying nearly 200 passengers in Ukraine, in an attack authorities blamed on Russia.

events.title: Netherlands set for minority coalition as parties reach deal
events.summary: Three Dutch political parties clinched a coalition deal but will have to rely on support from other parties to govern.

events.title: How does Germany deport people?
events.summary: Germany does not have masked ICE officers or an equivalent agency, but both Chancellor Friedrich Merz and his predecessor have done all they can to accelerate deportations. Here's how the process works.

events.title: Dutch court sentences Eritrean migrant smuggler to 20 years
events.summary: A Dutch court on Tuesday sentenced Eritrean Amanuel W. to 20 years in prison in the Netherlands' largest migrant smuggling case so far. More suspects are set to appear in court later this year.

events.title: FIFA ex-President Blatter backs call to boycott World Cup
events.summary: With the US due to co-host the football World Cup this summer, former FIFA President Sepp Blatter said a former colleague was "right" to advise supporters to "stay home" and watch on TV amid an immigration crackdown.

events.title: Germany's Green Party under pressure over Mercosur vote
events.summary: The Greens are big supporters of international agreements. But, now, eight German lawmakers in the European Parliament have all but scuppered the Mercosur free trade agreement — defying their party's leadership.

events.title: Protests in Iran: Ali Karimi leads sports' call for support
events.summary: Former Iran and Bayern Munich footballer Ali Karimi has signed an open letter, asking FIFA to act. He is not the only athlete to be vocal.

events.title: Plastic emissions could double health damage by 2040
events.summary: Plastic pollution could double its harm to human health in the coming decades if current production trends continue, according to a new study that links rising risks directly to the manufacture of new plastics.

events.title: IOC rejects extra Winter Olympics spot for skeleton's Uhlaender
events.summary: IOC President Kirsty Coventry had been asked to intervene after Katie Uhlaender was the victim of alleged competition manipulation, causing her to miss out on February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: German FA boss says World Cup boycott would be 'misguided'
events.summary: At the first DFL meeting of 2026, German FA boss Bernd Neuendorf spoke for the first time about a World Cup boycott.

events.title: Holocaust Remembrance Day: Europe remembers Nazi genocide
events.summary: Auschwitz survivor Tatiana Bucci has addressed MEPs in a special session. An event will be held at the Auschwitz-Birkenau memorial in Poland to commemorate the concentration camp's liberation 81 years ago.

events.title: Holocaust survivor Leon Weintraub: "We were dehumanized"
events.summary: The 100-year-old vividly recalls the hunger, death camps and cruelty of the guards. Thus, he tirelessly works to ensure that the Holocaust is never forgotten.

events.title: Paris Agreement 10 years on: More wins than you may realize
events.summary: Major emitter the US has officially left the Paris Agreement and global emissions keep rising a decade on from the deal. Yet renewables' growth shows climate action can work. Here's what's been done and what's missing.

events.title: Australian Open tennis encounters extreme heat
events.summary: Tournament organizers have instituted their extreme heat protocols amid blistering temperatures in the region.

events.title: France's lawmakers vote to ban social media for under-15s
events.summary: As social media usage has grown, it has heightened concerns about excessive screen time and its negative impact on child development and mental health.

events.title: EU, India clinch historic free trade deal
events.summary: The deal between Brussels and New Delhi aims to forge a market of 2 billion people and nearly a quarter of global GDP, according to the European Commission.

events.title: Ye aka Kanye West apologizes for antisemitic remarks
events.summary: The artist previously known as Kanye West blamed his behavior on bipolar disorder, saying he "lost touch with reality."

events.title: Berlin's young Jews reveal complex experiences with antisemitism
events.summary: Jewish people in Berlin have had varying experiences since October 7, 2023, but several DW spoke to say they have seen more antisemitism and have become increasingly cautious.

events.title: Germany, France, others rebuke Trump's NATO troop disrespect
events.summary: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said it would show "decency" for Donald Trump to apologize for comments on NATO troops in Afghanistan. "But we all know how the US president operates," Pistorius added.

events.title: Latin America waiting: What's next for the EU-Mercosur deal?
events.summary: The European Commission eyes pushing the bloc’s biggest ever trade deal ahead without the European Parliament’s okay ― for now.

events.title: Retrial in murder of Slovak journalist and fiancee begins
events.summary: The second retrial in the Jan Kuciak murder case began on January 26. Businessman Marian Kocner again faces charges after the Slovak Supreme Court overturned his previous two acquittals.

events.title: Gold breaks $5,000: What's fueling the price rally and where will it end?
events.summary: Gold continues to hit record highs, having already had a bumper run in 2025. Geopolitical and economic uncertainty are the key factors, while doubts over the US dollar are also attracting new investors.

events.title: EU pushes for deals as Trump's tariffs upset global trade
events.summary: Fear over Trump's tariff walls and the aggressive tone coming from the White House is pushing the European Union to focus on getting other trade agreements done. Despite all efforts, the EU sometimes gets in its own way.

events.title: Germany: Business index starts year with 'little momentum'
events.summary: Germany's Ifo business barometer was stagnant in January, bucking predictions of a slight improvement. A dip in confidence in the service sector put the brakes on improved sentiments in other areas.

events.title: Germany news: Bounty offered over Berlin power grid attack
events.summary: German authorities have offered a €1 million bounty for tips related to this month's massive Berlin blackout. Meanwhile, European leaders discussed energy and security cooperation in Hamburg. DW has more.

events.title: Calls grow for European teams to boycott World Cup 2026
events.summary: As with Russia in 2018 and Qatar in 2022, politics are dominating the buildup to North America's 2026 World Cup. Could discontent with Donald Trump in Europe see football heavyweights unite to boycott the tournament?

events.title: US–EU economic ties show why neither side can decouple
events.summary: Despite a pause in tariff escalation, US–EU trade remains volatile under Donald Trump. From deficits and energy to services and the dollar, the trans-Atlantic relationship reveals deep ties — and clear vulnerabilities.

events.title: Blood supplies running low in Germany
events.summary: A shortage of blood donations in Germany could have dramatic consequences. The situation was critical in mid-January. DW's Marcel Fürstenau answered a call to donate blood and reported on his experience.

events.title: Germany weighs boon and bane of China's industrial expansion
events.summary: From cheap exports to cutting-edge tech: A Chinese battery giant's secretive factory in Germany shows how "Made in China" and "Made in Germany" are colliding — and where they can benefit from each other.

events.title: Merz says Germany won't join Trump's 'Board of Peace'
events.summary: German Chancellor Merz said the current form of US President Trump's "Board of Peace" prevented Germany from joining for "constitutional reasons." But Merz said he was open to "new formats" of cooperation with the US.

events.title: 'Sweet Caroline' singer Neil Diamond turns 85
events.summary: He was a pop icon in the 1970s. Today, one of his songs is experiencing a viral resurgence. From soccer stadiums to TikTok, Neil Diamond's "Sweet Caroline" hasn't stopped playing.

events.title: Germany investigates Russian espionage case
events.summary: After identifying a suspected agent, Germany has expelled a Russian embassy employee and summoned the Russian ambassador.

events.title: Former Scorpions bassist, Francis Buchholz, dies aged 71
events.summary: The musician's family said he died following a battle with cancer. Buchholz played bass for the Scorpions rock band until 1992, during one of their most successful periods.

events.title: Rodman becomes new 'highest paid' women's footballer
events.summary: USA forward Trinity Rodman has re-signed with the Washington Spirit of the National Women's Soccer League in a deal that will reportedly pay her in excess of $2 million per season.

events.title: Trump, Zelenskyy, Carney dominate Davos 2026: As it happened
events.summary: The World Economic Forum has come to an end after a tense but ultimately anti-climactic week at Davos, with the US, Ukrainian and Canadian leaders attracting the most attention. Read DW's wrap of the summit.

events.title: Germany: Nord Stream suspect cannot claim immunity
events.summary: German judges have nixed an appeal by a Ukrainian national suspected of helping blow up an underwater gas pipeline to be freed from prosecution. Neighboring Poland is refusing to extradite his alleged co-conspirator.

events.title: Can China rely on domestic oil after Iran, Venezuela shocks?
events.summary: Donald Trump's moves against two key suppliers have revived debate over China’s fragile oil balance. With domestic output flat and oil fields aging, how much capacity — if any — exists to raise production?

events.title: Merz and Meloni reshape Germany-Italy relations
events.summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz and Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni are showing closer ties than their countries have in years. Meloni is no longer seen as a right-wing outsider, taking on a role as mediator with Donald Trump.

events.title: 'Sinners' breaks records at 2026 Oscar nominations
events.summary: The film by Ryan Coogler earned 16 nods for the 98th Academy Awards, which will be presented on March 15. A new Oscar category was also introduced for the first time in 25 years.

events.title: From Inuit to Vikings to Trump: The history of Greenland
events.summary: After being inhabited only by Indigenous peoples for centuries, the Arctic island saw the Vikings in the 10th century and the Danes in 1721, and it attracted US interest back in 1867.

events.title: Germany: Far-right extremist 'Saxon Separatists' stand trial
events.summary: The trial of 8 suspected right-wing extremists accused of planning a coup is beginning in the German city of Dresden. Their goal: A Nazi state.

events.title: Davos: Germany's Merz says old world order 'unraveling'
events.summary: German Chancellor Merz said the world has "entered an era of great power politics" where Russia and China challenge the US. In his speech at Davos, Merz said Europe must boost competitiveness and invest in defense.

events.title: UN backs boost in nature-saving business
events.summary: Global financing is heavily skewed to industries that harm rather than preserve nature, according to a new report that calls for an urgent scale-up of nature-positive spending.

events.title: Davos WEF: Trump touts policies, renews Greenland ambitions
events.summary: Donald Trump used his WEF speech to praise himself and lash out at Europe while offering little on the economy. Business and political leaders were expecting the worst, but much of it was for a domestic audience.

events.title: Germany's rail service dealt major blow by government
events.summary: The government is reportedly walking back promises to fund major projects for national train operator Deutsche Bahn. DB is beset by chronic punctuality problems, decrepit infrastructure and a lack of investment.

events.title: European Parliament votes to delay Mercosur deal in court
events.summary: Lawmakers voted narrowly to challenge the EU trade deal with Latin America in the bloc's top court, a move that could derail the deal. Chancellor Friedrich Merz said the deal should be provisionally enacted anyway.

events.title: Free solo climb on Netflix: 'If you fall, you're gonna die'
events.summary: Rock climber Alex Honnold plans to scale the facade of what was once the world's tallest building — live on Netflix. But not all are impressed by the idea.

events.title: Apple overtakes Samsung in phones sales worldwide
events.summary: After 14 years behind Samsung, Apple is back on top in global smartphone sales, just as Chinese rivals step up the pressure. Foldables and advanced AI are the new battleground in the fight for the next billion users.

events.title: WEF in Davos: Is Greenland the wake-up call Europe needed?
events.summary: Europe faces waning influence amid wars, trade tensions, climate inaction and a US administration quick to hurl insults at its oldest allies. In Davos, leaders discuss how Europe can regain its mojo.

events.title: Halabja Massacre: Survivors still haunted by chemical weapons strike
events.summary: Kurdish Iraqis who survived the 1988 chemical weapons attack on Halabja and nearby communities have lasting trauma, a new report finds, highlighting the need for long-term support.

events.title: How bringing back a humble algae to Arctic waters makes all the difference
events.summary: For decades, researchers in northern Norway had tried to bring back vital kelp forests after overfishing damaged marine ecosystems. Now a simple solution is proving successful.

events.title: Iran's economic woes expose regime's tight grip
events.summary: As religious elites and Revolutionary Guards strengthen their hold on the economy, experts question how long the regime can survive.

events.title: African fans fume at 'disgraceful' World Cup travel ban
events.summary: Senegal's football team are champions of Africa, but fans from the country are banned from going to the US for the World Cup. They aren't the only ones, with Donald Trump's hostility and FIFA ticket prices hitting hard.

events.title: Like potatoes? Berlin is giving away 4 million kilos
events.summary: As an initiative redistributes a bumper surplus of spuds, here's a look at the Germans' great love affair with the potato.

events.title: How can the EU respond to US 'blackmail' over Greenland?
events.summary: European leaders have three main options for responding to the Trump administration’s economic threats. If they don’t get it right, Trump may be emboldened to take over Greenland.

events.title: Meet Veronika, the clever cow with tools to scratch herself
events.summary: A cow in Austria has been observed using tools ― the first time such behavior has been recorded in cattle. Have we underestimated the gentle bovines all this time?

events.title: Why Germany probably won't get political at 2026 World Cup
events.summary: After their very public protest at the last World Cup in Qatar, Germany's football team looks unlikely to do the same in the United States in 2026.

events.title: 'Sentimental Value' sweeps European Film Awards. Next step, Oscars?
events.summary: Joachim Trier's drama won the top accolades, adding to the buzz ahead of the Oscar awards. Iran was also in the spotlight, with director Jafar Panahi decrying the government's brutal crackdown on protest.

events.title: WEF: Donald Trump set to dominate Davos 2026
events.summary: Weeks after attacking Venezuela, capturing its controversial leader, and reviving Greenland ambitions, the US president's presence in Davos is expected to raise the stakes at the WEF's annual meeting.

events.title: 8 fun facts about Dolly Parton for her 80th birthday
events.summary: Dolly Parton is one of the world's most successful artists. Now 80, she has an eventful life to look back over. Here are some important and extraordinary facts about the country music icon.

events.title: How European cinema is stealing Hollywood's spotlight
events.summary: As Hollywood doubles down on sequels, the contenders for the European Film Awards feature bold, political works that are challenging audiences and creating buzz far beyond the continent.

events.title: 2026 stargazing: Eclipses, meteor showers and supermoons
events.summary: 2026 will leave stargazers spoiled for sights in the sky, with four eclipse events, multiple meteor showers and several supermoons.

events.title: German firms hunker down as Trump marks one year in office
events.summary: One year into Donald Trump's second term, higher tariffs and sharper threats are straining transatlantic business. German companies in the US are weighing compliance against resistance as uncertainty grows.

events.title: Livestream: 4 award-winning filmmakers discuss risk-taking cinema
events.summary: DW co-hosts a talk with European Film Award and Oscar nominees Jafar Panahi, Oliver Laxe, Mascha Schilinski and Joachim Trier. Watch it live here.

events.title: NBA Europe to 'respect' European basketball tradition
events.summary: The NBA is pressing ahead with plans to launch a basketball league in Europe, with a slated launch date of 2027.

events.title: 'Charlie Hebdo' cartoon on Swiss fire tragedy sparks outrage
events.summary: A cartoon by the French satirical weekly portraying the deadly fire in Crans-Montana as the "comedy of the year" provokes disgust.

events.title: Women poised to take India sports to the next level
events.summary: India has been experiencing major growth in women's sports in recent years. This is being fuelled by investment from both the public and private sector – as well as many role models.

events.title: Wikipedia at 25: Of collective knowledge and its fault lines
events.summary: From utopian origins to AI-driven rivals, the "people's encyclopedia" has been shaped by debates over neutrality, expertise and the future of shared knowledge.

events.title: Louvre hikes ticket price for non-EU visitors by almost half
events.summary: The Louvre museum and several other French cultural sites are increasing the price of entry for visitors from outside Europe. So-called "dual pricing" is quite common in less wealthy countries but rare in richer regions.

events.title: International Space Station crew to make emergency return to Earth
events.summary: A medical emergency will force four astronauts aboard the International Space Station to return to Earth prematurely.

events.title: From the Monroe Doctrine to the Donroe Doctrine
events.summary: America for Americans: That was James Monroe's message to European colonial powers in 1823, to respect the independence of new nations of the Americas. Trump is reinterpreting this doctrine.

events.title: Kazakhstan oil output plunges as Ukraine's drones hit Russia
events.summary: Kyiv's attacks on Russian oil terminals and refineries may damage their enemy, but they are also having an impact on other economies such as Kazakhstan's and risk alienating allies.

events.title: Australians are changing their response to wildfires
events.summary: DW's Stuart Braun had a dangerously near miss during Australia's 2009 "Black Saturday" inferno. As this month's fires burned near his rural home, he wasn't taking any chances.

events.title: Australia: Writers' festival called off amid boycott
events.summary: The Adelaide Writers' Week retracted an invitation to an Australian-Palestinian author, citing the the Bondi Beach attack. Dozens, including the event's director and the former PM of New Zealand, withdrew in response.

events.title: Cannabis: Now you can measure how much is too much
events.summary: At what point does smoking weed get dangerous? A British study measured cannabis consumption in THC units and determined which amounts increase health risks. The system comes with clear risk thresholds ― and weaknesses.

events.title: Cheating scandal hits Winter Olympics skeleton qualifier
events.summary: An international sports governing body is investigating after a Canadian coach was accused of manipulating an event — depriving racers of qualifying points ahead of February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: Why Venus Williams and other sports stars are playing longer
events.summary: More than three decades after she burst onto the tennis scene, Venus Williams is still playing at the top level. Why are we seeing elite athletes carrying on into their 40s and beyond?

events.title: 2026 World Cup: Germany to be based at North Carolina hotel
events.summary: Germany will be making a hotel in Winston-Salem their base camp during next summer's World Cup. The choice of headquarters has been seen as key to the national team's success — or failure — at previous World Cups.

events.title: From Guatemala to Panama: US affairs in Latin America
events.summary: The US attack on Venezuela is part of a long history of military interventions and political influence by the United States in Latin America. Here are five such examples since World War II.

events.title: The impact of US withdrawal from global climate pacts
events.summary: The US has pledged to pull out of dozens of international organizations and treaties established to advance the protection of the planet. But it doesn't spell the end of environmental action.

events.title: What to watch out for as the Bundesliga resumes play
events.summary: Bayern Munich seem to have another Bundesliga title all but sealed. But could a serious challenger still emerge? And who is in danger of relegation? DW has you covered.

events.title: Ski jumping: 'Are they trying to pull a fast one on us?'
events.summary: Domen Prevc has followed in his brother's footsteps by winning the Four Hills Tournament. However, more than the Slovenian's achievement, this year's edition may be remembered for less pleasant reasons.

events.title: How clean energy could save us trillions
events.summary: As clean energy prices fall, a fast transition to renewable energy is the cheapest option on the table. Experts say it could save us trillions in energy costs alone.

events.title: T20 World Cup cricket: Why Bangladesh won't travel to India
events.summary: A month before the tournament begins, Bangladesh have said they will not play T20 World Cup matches in India. The decision comes on the back of political and sporting tensions between the countries.

events.title: Can developing countries leapfrog fossil fuels?
events.summary: Rich nations built their wealth on coal, oil and gas. Now the world is asking poorer countries like Mozambique to chart a different course.

events.title: Why plastic bans aren't working and what needs to change
events.summary: Four years after Germany phased out light plastic bags, how has the EU addressed plastic waste? And why do single-use items still pile up in takeaway restaurants, shops and the environment?

events.title: US envoy Witkoff holds ‘constructive’ Ukraine talks with Russia
events.summary: US envoy Steve Witkoff on Saturday said he had "productive and constructive meetings" with Kirill Dmitriev, Russian President Vladimir Putin's top economic adviser and special envoy, in Florida. The talks came a day before a scheduled meeting in Abu Dhabi between Ukrainian and Russian negotiators amid the Trump administration's drive to end the Ukraine war.

events.title: Deadly blast rips Iranian port city as Tehran plans naval drills in Strait of Hormuz
events.summary: An explosion at a building in the southern Iranian port city of Bandar Abbas on Saturday killed one person and wounded 14, according to authorities. The blast came a day before a planned Iranian naval drill in the strategic Strait of Hormuz. Amid frantic regional diplomatic efforts to de-escalate tensions, President Donald Trump on Saturday said Iran was "taking to us".

events.title: Trump’s policies ‘erodes the fabric of global cooperation’, ex-Swedish PM Bildt says
events.summary: As the UN stands on the brink of financial collapse, Iran stands on the brink of possible US strikes and many world leaders navigate how to handle US President Donald Trump, FRANCE 24 spoke to Carl Bildt, Sweden’s former prime minister, about the impact of the US leader’s foreign policies on the international community and rules-based order.

events.title: French tech giant Capgemini assists US Dept. of Homeland Security
events.summary: French technology company Capgemini has been assisting ICE immigration agents with expelling illegal immigrants from the United States. This discovery has led some to question whether this is work the company should be doing.

events.title: 'Creeping fascism': Milan protesters slam ICE deployment at Winter Olympics
events.summary: Protesters on Saturday gathered at Milan's Piazza XXV Aprile, a square named for the date of Italy’s liberation from Nazi fascism in 1945, to protest the deployment of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents during the upcoming Winter Olympics there. Demonstrators in the Italian city denounced what they called "creeping fascism" in the US.

events.title: Gas leaks blamed for explosions in two Iranian cities
events.summary: An explosion reported on Saturday at a residential building in the southern Iranian city of Bandar Abbas on the Gulf coast was the result of a gas leak, according to the local fire chief. Another explosions in the city of Ahvaz near the Iraqi border had also earlier been blamed on a gas leak, according to state media.

events.title: Explosions at two Iranian cities amid rising tensions with US
events.summary: At least one person was killed and 14 injured in an explosion in the ⁠southern Iranian port of Bandar Abbas on Saturday, a local official told Iranian news agencies, but the cause of the blast was not known. Separately, four people were killed after a gas explosion in the city of Ahvaz near the Iraqi border, according to state-run Tehran Times. The blasts come at a tense time after a major US military deployment to the region.

events.title: 'There's no ceasefire': Israeli strikes kill 30 Palestinians, including children, in Gaza
events.summary: Israeli air strikes killed at east 30 people in Gaza Saturday, including children, according to hospitals, as the military said it attacked in response to a Hamas ceasefire violation. Despite a US-brokered ceasefire entering its second phase earlier this month, violence in the Palestinian territory has continued, with both Israel and Hamas accusing each other of violating the truce agreement.

events.title: Iran explosions: What we know so far
events.summary: An explosion rocked the southern Iranian port of Bandar Abbas on Saturday, Iranian news agencies said, but the cause of the blast was not known. The semi-official Tasnim news agency said that social media reports alleging that a Revolutionary Guard navy commander had been targeted were "completely false". Separately, four people were killed after a gas explosion in the city of Ahvaz near the Iraqi border, according to state-run Tehran Times. France 24’s international affairs editor Kethevane Gorjestani takes a look at what we know so far.

events.title: Who are the Baloch Liberation Army, the group behind Pakistan attacks?
events.summary: Some 10 police and security personnel and 11 civilians were killed during orchestrated militant attacks across the southwestern province of Balochistan Saturday, Pakistan officials said. The banned separatist group Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) claimed responsibility for the attacks in a region that has faced a decades-long insurgency by ethnic Baloch militant groups. France 24’s correspondent Shahzaib Wahlah takes a closer look.

events.title: Catherine O'Hara, star of 'Schitt's Creek' and 'Home Alone,' dead at 71
events.summary: Catherine O’Hara, the shape-shifting Canadian comic actor whose characters ranged from the ⁠deliriously theatrical Moira Rose in "Schitt's Creek" to the frantic mother in “Home Alone,” has died at 71 — prompting an outpouring of tributes led by her co-star Macaulay Culkin and Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney.

events.title: Israeli strikes on Gaza kill dozens as violence continues despite ceasefire
events.summary: Hospitals in Gaza said Israeli strikes killed at least 29 Palestinians Saturday, one of the highest tolls since the October ceasefire aimed at stopping the fighting. A day after Israel accused Hamas of new ceasefire violations, strikes hit locations throughout Gaza, including lethal ones on an apartment building in Gaza City and a tent camp in Khan Younis, officials at hospitals that received the bodies said.

events.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 30 across Gaza in one of highest tolls since October ceasefire
events.summary: New Israeli air strikes slammed targets across Gaza on Saturday, including a Gaza City residential building and a tent camp Khan Younis, killing at least 30 people, hospital officials said. The strikes come just a day before the announced reopening of the enclave's Rafah crossing with Egypt and mark a continually rising death toll as Israel and Hamas trade accusations of violating the ceasefire.

events.title: Separatists launch 'coordinated' attacks in southwest Pakistan
events.summary: Ethnic Baloch separatists launched "coordinated" attacks across Pakistan's Balochistan province on Saturday, killing at least ten policemen, officials said, the latest violence in insurgency-hit southwest region. FRANCE 24's correspondent Shahzaib Wahlah reports that the situation in the provincial capital of Quetta remains tense.

events.title: Nigeria's Fela Kuti is first African musician honoured with Grammys Lifetime Achievement award
events.summary: Nigeria’s Afrobeat legend Fela Kuti will be posthumously honored this weekend with a Grammys Lifetime Achievement Award, becoming the first African artist to receive the prestigious distinction.

events.title: 'Technical malfunction' causes mass power outages in Ukraine
events.summary: Ukraine reported mass power outages across its power grid on Saturday due to a "technical malfunction" affecting international power lines. The power cuts come as Ukraine faces a particularly harsh winter and increased Russian attacks on energy infrastructure that have caused major disruption to heat, electricity and water provision in recent weeks.

events.title: Myanmar coup 5 years on: 'It has gone horrifically wrong for the military'
events.summary: This Sunday will mark five years since the military re-took control in Myanmar in a coup that ousted elected leader Aung San Suu Kyi. The military celebrated the anniversary by declaring a sweeping win for their political party in a general election, widely denounced as a sham. But, according to Mark Farmaner, director of the NGO "Burma Campaign UK", the five years since the coup have gone “horrifically wrong" for the military junta, which has lost control of vast swathes of the country to armed rebel groups.

events.title: Blockade, strikes: What are the US military's options in Iran?
events.summary: As more warships arrive near Iran to reinforce what US President Donald Trump calls the "Armada", what are the US's military options if it goes ahead with an intervention? Several scenarios are emerging, including a naval blockade that would prevent Iran from exporting its oil. Or surgical strikes against what remains of the Iranian regime's nuclear and ballistic programs.

events.title: Venezuelan interim president proposes mass amnesty law, closure of notorious prison
events.summary: Venezuela's acting president Delcy Rodriguez announced on Friday a push for mass amnesty in the country, saying she will propose a "general amnesty law covering the entire period of political violence from 1999 to the present." She also announced plans to close the notorious El Helicoide prison in Caracas, where rights groups say political prisoners were tortured by Nicolas Maduro's intelligence services.

events.title: Thousands take to streets in Minnesota and across US to protest ICE
events.summary: Thousands of protesters took to the streets in Minneapolis and ⁠students across the United States staged walkouts on Friday to demand the withdrawal of federal immigration agents from Minnesota following the fatal shootings of two US citizens. Meanwhile, rock star Bruce Springsteen lent his voice to the protest, taking the stage at a fundraiser for Good and Pretti in downtown Minneapolis and playing his new song "Streets of Minneapolis".

events.title: Trump, Musk cited in new batch of Epstein files released by US DoJ
events.summary: The US Justice Department has released more than 3 million pages of records from its investigative files on Jeffrey Epstein, resuming disclosures about what the government knew about the millionaire financier’s sexual abuse of young girls. The latest release includes thousands of references to US President Donald Trump, hundreds to Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, formerly known as Britain’s Prince Andrew, and details of conversations with billionaire Tesla founder Elon Musk.

events.title: Djokovic rolls back the years to beat Sinner in Melbourne semi-final
events.summary: Novak Djokovic came back from behind to qualify for his 11th Australian Open final on Friday, taking down reigning champion Jannik Sinner in a five-set epic.

events.title: Scores killed in Baloch separatist attack in southwest Pakistan
events.summary: Baloch separatists launched a deadly series of "coordinated' attacks at more than 12 locations in Pakistan's Balochistan province on Saturday, an official said. At least 11 civilians, 10 security officials and 67 insurgents were killed, according to authorities.

events.title: Two explosions reported in Iran
events.summary: Two explosions have been reported in Iran as the regime denied a ‌military leader was targeted, amid heightened tension in the region.

events.title: Macaulay Culkin pays tribute to Home Alone star Catherine O'Hara
events.summary: Catherine O'Hara, the Emmy-winning actress who starred as Kevin's mother in Home Alone and the eccentric Moira Rose in Schitt's Creek, has died.

events.title: Hundreds protest against ICE role in Winter Olympics in Milan
events.summary: Hundreds of protesters have gathered in Milan, Italy, to protest against the deployment of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) staff at the upcoming Winter Olympics.

events.title: Northern Ireland should hold unity referendum by 2030, first minister says
events.summary: Northern Ireland should hold a referendum on whether it should become part of a united Ireland by 2030, the country's first minister has said.

events.title: Search operation for missing girl hindered by storm, MP says
events.summary: The search operation for a seven-year-old girl who was swept out to sea in Morocco has been "hindered" by a storm, an MP has said.

events.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 30 Palestinians in Gaza, hospital officials say
events.summary: At least 30 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli strikes on Saturday, according to hospitals in Gaza.

events.title: More than 200 killed after landslide collapses smartphone mineral mines
events.summary: More than 200 people have been reported dead after a landslide hit coltan mines in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

events.title: Blackouts in Ukraine and Moldova as power lines fail in sub-zero temperatures after Russian airstrikes
events.summary: Parts of Ukraine and Moldova suffered power cuts on Saturday after high-voltage power lines failed while both countries were affected by sub-zero temperatures.

events.title: Pokémon apologises after Chinese anger over plan for game at Japanese shrine
events.summary: Pokémon has apologised after plans for a card game event at a controversial shrine for Japanese war dead saw it accused of hurting "the feelings of the Chinese people".

events.title: Astronauts are about to go back to the moon - here's what you need to know
events.summary: NASA is poised to send astronauts around the moon and back for the first time in more than 50 years.

events.title: US ambassador arrives in Venezuela to reopen diplomatic mission after 7 years
events.summary: U.S. Ambassador Laura Dogu has arrived in Caracas.

events.title: Hungarian Roma protest inflammatory comments by Orbán government minister
events.summary: Over a thousand protesters, including many from Hungary's Roma community, have held a demonstration in Budapest where they demanded the resignation of a prominent government minister over comments seen as racist

events.title: Pope gets invitation to visit Peru during a Vatican garden party, then stays for lunch
events.summary: Peru’s ambassador to the Holy See has publicly invited Pope Leo XIV to visit

events.title: Japan, Britain to boost cybersecurity and critical minerals cooperation as China’s influence grows
events.summary: Japan and Britain have agreed to boost cooperation on cybersecurity and the supply of critical minerals

events.summary: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk’s relationship with party leaders in China is in the spotlight as the trade war ramps up. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on what this means for his popularity in the country.

events.title: Through carnage of the government crackdown, Iranian protesters looked to Trump
events.summary: Through the carnage of Iran’s violent protest crackdown, the one thought that kept P. going was that President Donald Trump was behind them.

events.title: Iran ready for talks or war, foreign minister says as Trump weighs military action
events.summary: Pressure was building on Iran on Friday as President Donald Trump weighed a military strike on the Islamic Republic and the Treasury Department sanctioned several officials it said were responsible for the regime’s brutal crackdown on its own people.

events.title: U.S. warns Iran over planned military drills close to American forces
events.summary: The United States warned Iran on Saturday over its plans to conduct live-fire drills close to U.S. forces in the region, as partners sought to de-escalate rising tensions between the two nations

events.title: Confusion in Kyiv and Moscow after Trump says Putin agreed to pause attacks for a week
events.summary: Confusion reigned about whether Russian President Vladimir Putin had agreed to halt strikes on Ukraine after President Donald Trump said he asked him to stop.

events.title: Unnerved by Trump, U.S. allies are making nice with China
events.summary: Since the start of the year, as President Donald Trump has alienated U.S. allies with his attack on Venezuela, demands for control of Greenland and new tariff threats, their leaders have been reviving ties with another country: China.

events.title: Palestinians crowded into Gaza tents struggle to see a better future even as ceasefire progresses
events.summary: A key border crossing is set to reopen, the ceasefire is moving forward and the United States is imagining a gleaming new Gaza, but Palestinians in the devastated enclave are still struggling to simply survive

events.title: Russia faces a heavy price for limited gains in Ukraine war, death toll estimates suggest
events.summary: After nearly four years, the grinding war between Russia and Ukraine is approaching a staggering battlefield toll: nearly half a million dead and 1½ million wounded or missing across both sides

events.title: Trump warns Iran time for nuclear deal is running out, says U.S. armada is ready for 'violence'
events.summary: Time is running out for Iran to make a deal, President Donald Trump warned Wednesday, as he urged the Islamic Republic to negotiate on nuclear weapons or face the force of a “massive armada” of American ships.“Like with Venezuela, it is, ready, willing, and able to rapidly fulfill its mission, with speed and violence, if necessary,” Trump said in a post on Truth Social, adding that the fleet was “moving quickly, with great power, enthusiasm, and purpose.”

events.title: ICE role at the Winter Olympics prompts fury in Italy
events.summary: Italian officials reacted with anger at the news that a part of ICE, Homeland Security Investigations, will play a role in Olympic security next month.

events.title: Shaped by ancient humans, 430,000-year-old wooden tools are the oldest ever found
events.summary: Used by our early human ancestors around 430,000 years ago, the earliest known hand-held wooden tools have been uncovered by researchers in Greece.

events.title: Remains of last Israeli hostage found in Gaza, paving way for next phase of ceasefire
events.summary: The remains of the last hostage held in Gaza have been identified, the Israeli military said Monday, ending a more than two-year saga for captives' families in Israel — and paving the way for the second phase of the ceasefire in the war-torn enclave.

events.title: Alex Honnold describes his rope-free climb up Taipei 101 skyscraper
events.summary: Stay present for each move at a time, over and over.

events.title: Iranians return to daily life in a capital scarred by deadly protests
events.summary: TEHRAN, Iran — Massive protests rocked Iran in recent weeks but appear to have largely subsided after a brutal crackdown that has left at least 3,117 dead, according to official figures

events.title: Trump praises U.K. troops after backlash over NATO 'front lines' remarks
events.summary: President Donald Trump on Saturday commended British troops who fought in Afghanistan, backtracking on earlier remarks that drew criticism from NATO allies

events.title: Jared Kushner's vision for Gaza as a gleaming port city clashes with reality
events.summary: President Donald Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner this week unveiled plans for a “New Gaza” filled with gleaming high-rise towers and tourist-packed beaches — an optimistic vision that stands in stark contrast to the reality of a territory in ruins after two years of war
